canvases.label: Architectural Ornaments of the Middle Ages, pl.19

metadata.value: This is the English title but the book is also written in German and French
metadata.label: Title Notes

metadata.value: Heideloff is known for his architecture and as being the master builder of Nuremburg. He is also noted for his restoration of buildings and monuments. This book has been put together by hand, not bound together but placed in the cover as a portfolio style. The page that is digitized is of column capitals and friezes. Each are labelled with a letter to coordinate with a description (on a page not shown here). This was Heideloff’s last publication before his death in 1865.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Binding: unbound in portfolio. Nineteenth-century portfolio, from Trustee's Academy: half green morocco with marbled paper. Handwritten title label on front, including item number of contents: (60) Heideloffs Ornaments of the Middle Ages.
metadata.label: Material

metadata.value: On the top right hand corner is a hand-written inscription of the number 60
metadata.label: Inscription

metadata.value: Large, oval black ink stamp on pts. 1-7: Trustees for Manufactures &c in Scotland.
metadata.label: Provenance Notes

metadata.value: Architectural Ornaments of the Middle Ages, pl.19
metadata.label: Repro Title

canvases.label: Architectural Ornaments of the Middle Ages, Front cover

metadata.value: This is the English title but the book is also written in German and French
metadata.label: Title Notes

metadata.value: This cover page is inscrbed by hand with the English title and catalogue numbering 'YF74' as it was part of the Board of Trustees' Academy library. Following this is also the number (60) which is to refer to the number of contents inside. This is interesting in that it is written primarily in French and German, yet has an English translated title.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Binding: unbound in portfolio. Nineteenth-century portfolio, from Trustee's Academy: half green morocco with marbled paper. Handwritten title label on front, including item number of contents: (60) Heideloffs Ornaments of the Middle Ages.
